content.en: Precision farming: Scientists have been using machine learning algorithms to address various research questions in the field of animal agriculture. These algorithms, such as random forest, naive Bayes, and support vector machines, are being employed to predict outcomes like survival to second lactation in cattle, insufficient herbage allowance, lameness in dairy herds, udder health status, and more. By analyzing data from sensors and farm-based records, these algorithms are helping researchers make informed decisions and improve animal health and productivity.
content.da: Præcisionslandbrug: Forskere har anvendt maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at besvare forskellige forskningsspørgsmål inden for dyreproduktion. Disse algoritmer, såsom random forest, naiv Bayes og support vector machines, anvendes til at forudsige udfald som overlevelse til anden laktation hos kvæg, utilstrækkelig græsbevillig, halthed i malkebesætninger, yversundhedstilstand og mere. Ved at analysere data fra sensorer og gårdbaserede optegnelser hjælper disse algoritmer forskerne med at træffe informerede beslutninger og forbedre dyrehelse og produktivitet.
